sen.e: Tominokoji family was a toshoke (the hereditary lineage of court nobles allowed to enter the tenjonoma in the palace) in the line of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 元来は九条家の諸大夫だった富小路俊通が二条家の庶家を自称する形で従三位に昇ったことから始まる。
sen.e: This family was originated from the fact that Toshimichi TOMINOKOJI who was originally a shodaibu (aristocracy lower than Kugyo) of the Kujo family was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) by insisting that his family was a branch family of the Nijo family.
